alert.note: Alert for Cullman; Marshall; Morgan (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 3:09PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Marshall, northeastern Cullman and southeastern Morgan Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 308 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Holly Pond, or 9 miles southwest of Arab. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Arab, Holly Pond, Baileyton, Ryan Crossroads, Joppa and Hulaco. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
